taskGroup.name: First steps
taskGroup.intro: This cheat sheet will guide you through the process of starting a new project, creating some mappings and finally exporting results.

task.name: Example project
task.intro: This step will get you a first view of how a set up project could look like and lets you add some mappings.
task.onCompletion: You now got a first view of the Humboldt Alignment Editor, now start your own project.

task.name: Creating a new project
task.intro: This cheat sheet is intended to set up your environment.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations you now are able to set up a project.

task.name: Creating some mappings
task.intro: This cheat sheet will show you how to create some mappings between source and target schema.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations you now know how to create mappings on your own project.

task.name: Analyze the schema types
task.intro: This cheat sheet will show you where to start the harmonisation process, after source and target schema were imported.
task.onCompletion: Make sure, you have some matches prepared before proceeding to the next cheat sheet.

task.name: Create the mapping for Types
task.intro: This cheat sheet will show you, how to create the mapping between Types.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations, you have mapped all types.

task.name: Continue with Properties
task.intro: This cheat sheet will show you where to continue the harmonisation process, after all Types were mapped.
task.onCompletion: Make sure, you have some matches prepared before proceeding to the next cheat sheet.

task.name: Create the mapping for the Properties
task.intro: This cheat sheet will show you, how to create the mapping between Properties.
